message.content:
cs.NI, cs.IT, cs.MA, cs.SY, cs.MM

The paper discusses the concept of moving small cells in mobile networks to offload traffic hotspots. This topic falls under the area of network infrastructure and architecture, which is covered by the cs.NI (Networking and Internet Architecture) sub-category. The paper also considers the dynamics of the system, which involves modeling and analysis, indicating a possible fit with the cs.IT (Information Theory) sub-category. The use of a queuing model suggests a connection to the cs.MA (Multi-Agent Systems) sub-category, while the consideration of mutual interferences between cells points to the cs.SY (Systems and Control) sub-category. Finally, the deployment of small cells on a moving vehicle and the potential impact on user experience and quality of service could be relevant to the cs.MM (Multimedia) sub-category.
